intro: Hieracium torquescens, commonly known as the twisted hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, typically found in meadows and grassy areas. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, with ray florets that are often curled or twisted, giving it its common name. Its leaves are usually rough and hairy, with a distinctive lobed shape. Hieracium torquescens is a perennial plant that thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
